ygData.subject: Re: an (incorrect) Idea by "Gazamel Prime"
ygData.msgSnippet: I ve been a gnome since March last year and I always remembered seeing the king as a shrunken human. I don t recall ever seeing him the size of a normal human
ygData.messageBody:
I've been a gnome since March last year and I always remembered seeing the
king as a shrunken human. I don't recall ever seeing him the size of a
normal human or as a clockwork or anything else. Umm, by the way, why does
it really matter?

Brillian



----- Original Message -----
From: Drake, Robert, CTR, SAM-OPAA <Robert.Drake@...>
To: <EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, January 18, 2000 11:37 AM
Subject: RE: [EQ_Tinkering] an (incorrect) Idea by "Gazamel Prime"


> From: "Drake, Robert, CTR, SAM-OPAA" <Robert.Drake@...>
>
> Well, actually all gnomes should know this by now who are not Newbies.
Our
> King IS a Gnome Enchanter. He keeps casting Illusion Human on himself.
As
> for why he looks small, its a relatively new bug. The GM Admin must be
> mistaken. Until the last patch or so, the King was always a normal height
> human illusion and since the patch he's small lookin. Someone else in
> todays Tinker Mail explained the cause and how the bug works.
>
> And besides, who ever heard of Gnomes being rules by a human?!
>
> Kilkin
>
>
> > ----------
> > From: beatles901
> > Reply To: EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com
> > Sent: Tuesday, January 18, 2000 2:36 PM
> > To: EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com
> > Subject: Re: [EQ_Tinkering] an (incorrect) Idea by "Gazamel Prime"
> >
> > From: "beatles901" <beatles901@...>
> >
> > From what I've heard so far, you've been misleading us on different
trails
> > for every message you've sent almost. I sit here and wonder why you come
> > up
> > with such lies. I spoke with an ADMIN GM and not a guide and was told
> > that
> > the King is actually a tiny human, and not in illusion form. Good thing
> > you're a warrior too...because that would explain the level of
> > intelligence
> > :)
> >
> > Raksar Everheart, level 50 Gnomish Enchanter
> > 189 skill in Tinkering
> >
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: Gazamel Prime <gazamel@...>
> > To: <EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com>
> > Sent: Monday, January 17, 2000 2:48 PM
> > Subject: Re: [EQ_Tinkering] an Idea
> >
> >
> > > From: Gazamel Prime <gazamel@...>
> > >
> > > Yay, I was hoping someone else figured this out
> > > besides me. The king is an enchanter, and he's
> > > typically in human form. I'm fairly certain that if
> > > you cancel magic on him (not an aggressive spell) that
> > > you'd see his true form. Being a warrior, I can't
> > > really cast this spell, so I've yet to see this =)
> > >
> > > Gazamel
> > >
> > > --- Yigman008@... wrote:
> > > > the king isn't a clockwork, the clockwork next to it
> > > > is, if ou say hail next
> > > > to one of those spider ones, no matter which one it
> > > > is, it says unit not
> > > > authorized for speaking or somethin.
